sn48.39:3.1: 39 The Simile of the Fire Sticks
sn48.39:4.3: The faculties of pleasure, pain, happiness, sadness, and equanimity.
sn48.39:4.4: The faculty of pleasure arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
sn48.39:4.5: When in a state of pleasure, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of pleasure.’
sn48.39:4.6: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as pleasant, you understand that the corresponding faculty of pleasure ceases and stops.
sn48.39:5.1: The faculty of pain arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.
sn48.39:5.2: When in a state of pain, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of pain.’
sn48.39:5.3: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as painful, you understand that the corresponding faculty of pain ceases and stops.
sn48.39:6.1: The faculty of happiness arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as happy.
sn48.39:6.2: When in a state of happiness, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of happiness.’
sn48.39:6.3: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as happy, you understand that the corresponding faculty of happiness ceases and stops.
sn48.39:7.1: The faculty of sadness arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as sadness.
sn48.39:7.2: When in a state of sadness, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of sadness.’
sn48.39:7.3: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as happy, you understand that the corresponding faculty of happiness ceases and stops.
sn48.39:8.1: The faculty of equanimity arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as equanimous.
sn48.39:8.2: When in a state of equanimity, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of equanimity.’
sn48.39:8.3: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as equanimous, you understand that the corresponding faculty of equanimity ceases and stops.
sn48.39:9.1: When you rub two sticks together, heat is generated and fire is produced.
sn48.39:9.2: But when you part the sticks and lay them aside, any corresponding heat ceases and stops.
sn48.39:9.3: In the same way, the faculty of pleasure arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
sn48.39:9.4: When in a state of pleasure, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of pleasure.’
sn48.39:9.5: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as pleasant, you understand that the corresponding faculty of pleasure ceases and stops.

sn48.39:10.5: When in a state of equanimity, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of equanimity.’
sn48.39:10.6: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as equanimous, you understand that the corresponding faculty of equanimity ceases and stops.”
